name: Specter's Shroud
text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0.
Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

name: Specter's Wail
text: Target player discards a card at random.

editions.flavor: As he gritted his teeth to focus through the pain, Tahngarth glanced at Takara. She seemed completely unaffected.

name: Spectral Bears
text: Whenever Spectral Bears attacks, if defending player controls no black nontoken permanents, it doesn't untap during your next untap step.

editions.flavor: "I hear there are Bears—or spirits—that guard caravans passing through the forest." —Gulsen, Abbey Matron

"I hear there are bears—or spirits—that guard caravans passing through the forest."
—Gulsen, abbey matron

name: Spectral Cloak
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has shroud as long as it's untapped. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

name: Spectral Flight
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.

editions.flavor:
"The church looks down on binding spirits into armor, but now I can look down on them."
—Dierk, geistmage

name: Spectral Force
text:
Trample
Whenever Spectral Force attacks, if defending player controls no black permanents, it doesn't untap during your next untap step.

editions.flavor:
"The spirits of old have not left us unguarded."
—Uros, Pendelhaven elder

name: Spectral Gateguards
text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Spectral Gateguards is paired with another creature, both creatures have vigilance.

name: Spectral Grasp
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack you or a planeswalker you control.
Enchanted creature can't block creatures you control.

name: Spectral Guardian
text: As long as Spectral Guardian is untapped, noncreature artifacts have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)

editions.flavor:
"A treasure to guard other treasures is worth the highest price."
—Mtai, Civic Guildmage

name: Spectral Lynx
text:
Protection from green
{B}: Regenerate Spectral Lynx.

editions.flavor: A shadowy version of its corporeal cousin, this lynx hunts souls, not meals.

name: Spectral Prison
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell, sacrifice Spectral Prison.

name: Spectral Procession
text: Create three 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying.

editions.flavor:
"The dead have it easy. They suffer no more. If breaking their rest helps the living, so be it."
—Olka, mistmeadow witch

"I need never remember my past associates, my victims, my mistakes. Innistrad preserves them all for me."
—Sorin Markov

"I need never remember my past associates, my victims, my mistakes. Innistrad preserves them all for me."
—Sorin Markov

name: Spectral Reserves
text: Create two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying. You gain 2 life.

editions.flavor:
"My predecessors taught me of duty and commitment. It seems they have more to teach."
—Wendin, veteran cathar

name: Spectral Rider
text: Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)

editions.flavor: Never a word. Never a warning. Only the sound of hoofbeats along the crossways, and the screams of the avenged.

name: Spectral Searchlight
text: {T}: Choose a player. That player adds one mana of any color he or she chooses to his or her mana pool.

editions.flavor: The first searchlights were given as gifts, symbols of cooperation, to the emissaries present at the signing of the Guildpact.
The first searchlights were given as gifts, symbols of cooperation, to the emissaries present at the signing of the Guildpact.

name: Spectral Shepherd
text:
Flying
{1}{U}: Return target Spirit you control to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: The restless geists of common folk often continue their lifelong labors.

name: Spectral Shield
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 and can't be the target of spells.

editions.flavor:
"What can be a stronger shield than concealment? Have you ever defeated an enemy you didn't know existed?"
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen

"What can be a stronger shield than concealment? Have you ever defeated an enemy you didn't know existed?"
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen

name: Spectral Shift
text:
Choose one —
• Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one basic land type with another. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
• Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
Entwine {2} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

name: Spectral Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have "{2}: This creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn."

editions.flavor:
"Sure, I've seen agents of the Cabal here and there. Well, not here, and certainly not in any of the sliver labs. Oh dear, I've said too much."

name: Spectra Ward
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has protection from all colors. This effect doesn't remove Auras. (It can't be blocked, targeted, or dealt damage by anything that's white, blue, black, red, or green.)

name: Speedway Fanatic
text:
Haste
Whenever Speedway Fanatic crews a Vehicle, that Vehicle gains haste until end of turn.

editions.flavor: If her vehicle even has a brake, she couldn't tell you which pedal it is.

name: Spellbane Centaur
text: Creatures you control can't be the targets of blue spells or abilities from blue sources.

editions.flavor: "No mage's deception can harm those who keep nature balanced."

name: Spellbinder
Spell Blast
text: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X. (For example, if that spell's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}, X is 5.)

editions.flavor: Call it the thinking mage's version of brute force.

Call it the thinking mage's version of brute force.

name: Spellbook
text: You have no maximum hand size.

editions.flavor:
"Everything the wise woman learned she wrote in a book, and when the pages were black with ink, she took white ink and began again."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Spellbound Dragon
text:
Flying
Whenever Spellbound Dragon attacks, draw a card, then discard a card. Spellbound Dragon gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the discarded card's converted mana cost.

editions.flavor: A king in Jund, a serf in Esper.

name: Spellbreaker Behemoth
text:
Spellbreaker Behemoth can't be countered.
Creature spells you control with power 5 or greater can't be countered.

editions.flavor:
"Some think its immunity to countermagic evolved because of the constant mage attacks on Naya. I think it just ate a bunch of wizards."
—Broka, drumhunter

name: Spell Burst
text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Counter target spell with converted mana cost X.

editions.flavor: The brutish mage's version of thinking.

name: Spell Contortion
text:
Multikicker {1}{U} (You may pay an additional {1}{U} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2}. Draw a card for each time Spell Contortion was kicked.

name: Spell Counter
text:
Counter target spell.
Gotcha Whenever an opponent says "Spell" or "Counter," you may say "Gotcha" If you do, return Spell Counter from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Playing Unhinged, . . .

name: Spell Crumple
text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on the bottom of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard. Put Spell Crumple on the bottom of its owner's library.

name: Spellgorger Barbarian
text:
When Spellgorger Barbarian enters the battlefield, discard a card at random.
When Spellgorger Barbarian leaves the battlefield, draw a card.

editions.flavor: The epidemic insanity had a lasting effect on certain barbarians—but no one noticed.

name: Spellheart Chimera
text:
Flying, trample
Spellheart Chimera's power is equal to the number of instant and sorcery cards in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: Thaumaturges remain silent around chimeras, lest their words conjure even stranger beasts.
Thaumaturges remain silent around chimeras, lest their words conjure even stranger beasts.

name: Spelljack
text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard. You may play it without paying its mana cost for as long as it remains exiled. (If it has X in its mana cost, X is 0.)

name: Spell Pierce
text: Counter target noncreature spell unless its controller pays {2}.

editions.flavor:
"There's a hole in your plan."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage

name: Spell Queller
text:
Flash
Flying
When Spell Queller enters the battlefield, exile target spell with converted mana cost 4 or less.
When Spell Queller leaves the battlefield, the exiled card's owner may cast that card without paying its mana cost.

name: Spell Rupture
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}, where X is the greatest power among creatures you control.

editions.flavor:
"Like water, mana will drain from an inferior vessel."
—Jalan Tosk, Simic forcemage

name: Spellshift
text: Counter target instant or sorcery spell. Its controller reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals an instant or sorcery card. That player may cast that card without paying its mana cost. Then he or she shuffles his or her library.

name: Spellshock
text: Whenever a player casts a spell, Spellshock deals 2 damage to that player.

editions.flavor: A snap of fingers, a snap of teeth.
A snap of fingers, a snap of teeth.

name: Spell Shrivel
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {4}. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.

name: Spellskite
text: {U/P}: Change a target of target spell or ability to Spellskite. ({U/P} can be paid with either {U} or 2 life.)

name: Spell Snare
text: Counter target spell with converted mana cost 2.

editions.flavor: Every culture has its unlucky numbers. In a city where you're either alone, in a crowd, or being stabbed in the back, two is the worst number of all.
Every culture has its unlucky numbers. In a city where you're either alone, in a crowd, or being stabbed in the back, two is the worst number of all.

name: Spell Snip
text:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.

editions.flavor:
"Magic cast through a hand of flesh is just as weak as the flesh itself."

name: Spellstutter Sprite
text:
Flash
Flying
When Spellstutter Sprite enters the battlefield, counter target spell with converted mana cost X or less, where X is the number of Faeries you control.

name: Spell Syphon
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each blue permanent you control.

editions.flavor: Warrik Brutehexer felt betrayed that his aura favored the depths of the Wanderbrine River over its rightful place, hovering around him.

name: Spelltithe Enforcer
text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, that player sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {1}.

editions.flavor: His assistants calculate the amount of the tribute. He measures out the punishment for delinquency.

name: Spelltwine
text: Exile target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard and target instant or sorcery card from an opponent's graveyard. Copy those cards. Cast the copies if able without paying their mana costs. Exile Spelltwine.

name: Spellweaver Helix
text:
Imprint — When Spellweaver Helix enters the battlefield, you may exile two target sorcery cards from a single graveyard.
Whenever a player casts a card, if it has the same name as one of the cards exiled with Spellweaver Helix, you may copy the other. If you do, you may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.

name: Spellweaver Volute
text:
Enchant instant card in a graveyard
Whenever you cast a sorcery spell, copy the enchanted instant card. You may cast the copy without paying its mana cost. If you do, exile the enchanted card and attach Spellweaver Volute to another instant card in a graveyard.

name: Spellwild Ouphe
text: Spells that target Spellwild Ouphe cost {2} less to cast.

editions.flavor:
"You'd think that their big glowing eyes would be almost hypnotic to look at. In fact, it's the other way around—they are entranced by nearly everything they see."
—Balecki, Spellwild druid

name: Sphere of Duty
text: If a green source would deal damage to you, prevent 2 of that damage.

editions.flavor: Duty subdues instinct.

name: Sphere of Grace
text: If a black source would deal damage to you, prevent 2 of that damage.

editions.flavor: Grace repels darkness.

name: Sphere of Law
text: If a red source would deal damage to you, prevent 2 of that damage.

editions.flavor: Law smothers anarchy.

name: Sphere of Purity
text: If an artifact would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.

editions.flavor: Purity rejects artifice.

name: Sphere of Reason
text: If a blue source would deal damage to you, prevent 2 of that damage.

editions.flavor: Reason exposes deception.

name: Sphere of Resistance
text: Spells cost {1} more to cast.

editions.flavor: A sphere pushes equally in all directions.

"At the outset, we weren't aware of Chief Baral's motives for the project. It's now apparent that he intends to use the device to hamper the ‘mages' among the ranks of the renegades."
—Consulate engineer's log
A sphere pushes equally in all directions.

name: Sphere of Safety
text: Creatures can't attack you or a planeswalker you control unless their controller pays {X} for each of those creatures, where X is the number of enchantments you control.

editions.flavor: The Rakdos believe that all are eager to join their revels, even when told otherwise.

text:
Sphere of the Suns enters the battlefield tapped and with three charge counters on it.

name: Sphere of Truth
text: If a white source would deal damage to you, prevent 2 of that damage.

editions.flavor: Truth tempers fanaticism.

name: Sphinx Ambassador
text:
Flying
Whenever Sphinx Ambassador deals combat damage to a player, search that player's library for a card, then that player names a card. If you searched for a creature card that isn't the named card, you may put it onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

name: Sphinx-Bone Wand

Its host's final curse lies captured within.

Flying
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

Flying

Flying

Instant and sorcery spells you control can't be countered by spells or abilities.

text: Flying, first strike, vigilance, lifelink, protection from red and from green

text:
Flying
When Sphinx of Uthuun enters the battlefield, reveal the top five cards of your library. An opponent separates those cards into two piles. Put one pile into your hand and the other into your graveyard.

name: Sphinx's Disciple
text:
Flying
Inspired — Whenever Sphinx's Disciple becomes untapped, draw a card.

editions.flavor: Few dare to brave the Dakra Isles. Those who return are forever changed.

text: {2}{U}, {T}, Sacrifice a white creature, a blue creature, and a black creature: Search your library for a card named Sphinx Sovereign and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: He calls a riddle through the gaps of cloven clouds, hoping for an answer.

name: Sphinx Sovereign
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your end step, you gain 3 life if Sphinx Sovereign is untapped. Otherwise, each opponent loses 3 life.

editions.flavor: "What rises without legs, whispers without a voice, bites without teeth, and dies without having life?"

name: Sphinx's Revelation
text: You gain X life and draw X cards.

editions.flavor: "Let the knowledge of absolute law inspire you to live a life of absolute order."

name: Sphinx's Tutelage
text:

{5}{U}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

editions.flavor: "You've never considered the implications of dealing with another telepath, Jace."

name: Sphinx Summoner
text:
Flying
